solution.text:
Given pair of equations are:
_{i}_x + _{j}_y = _{{7*j}}_ and kx + _{i}_y = _{{3*i}}_.
_{i}_x + _{j}_y - _{{7*j}}_ = 0 -------(1)
kx + _{i}_y - _{{3*i}}_ = 0 -------(2)
Comparing with general equations, we get:
\(a_1 = _{i}_ ,a_2 = k ,b_1 = _{j}_ ,b_2 = _{i}_ ,c_1 = -_{{7*j}}_, c_2 = -_{{3*i}}_\)
For no unique solution following is the criteria:
i.e., \({a_1\over a_2} = {b_1\over b_2}\)
i.e., \({_{i}_\over k} = {_{j}_\over _{i}_}\)
i.e., \(k = {_{{i*i}}_\over _{j}_}\)

content.text:
Find the value of k for which following pair of equation doesn't have unique solution.
_{i}_x + _{j}_y = _{{7*j}}_ and kx + _{i}_y = _{{3*i}}_.
